description:
THE ORIGINAL CAT FLAG

NOW ON A BASEBALL JERSEY!

chest     18           20.5          22            24

 

hem       18           20.5          22            24

 


All our shirts are 100% guaranteed with returns and exchanges up to 14 days after proof of purchase.

photo catflag_zps050a3a26.jpg


Always remember that you are buying a one of a kind, hand printed t-shirt which is represented as best as it can be by the photograph. However, beyond the color of the material itself, there will always be some minor variations in the printing of our high quality shirts.

SPECIAL NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BUYERS: Please be aware that unless you use the very expensive Global Priority Mail option there is absolutely no way to track packages overseas. However, with every order we do generate a courtesy label that proves through the U.S. Postal system that we have both processed and shipped your order and that it is on the way. The good news is that we almost never encounter any lost packages. As a matter of fact we have only had 2 in 3,000 orders come up missing. In the past we have had a couple packages take almost 6-8 weeks to arrive, so sometimes it is just a matter of patience and understanding that when dealing with international parcel exchanges there are many variables and persons handling your item. That said, we cannot be held responsible for them once they are shipped. Thank you so much for all your great support!

name: GUCCI MANE Roderic Davis T-Shirt HUGE PRINT Sizes Small thru X-Large
description:
While serving a six-month jail term for assault in late 2005, gucci Mane (Roderic Davis) was charged with murder, though the charges were later dropped due to a lack of evidence. In 2009, he served a year-long county jail sentence for violating probation for his 2005 aggravated assault conviction....

Well, you know, it's Gucci Mane and the print covers the entire front of the shirt! This is the largest print we've ever done.

Sizes: Small thru X-Large
(To special order a larger size drop us a line and we'll tell you how to.)

Small /Medium /Large/ X-Large
Sleeve: 7” / 8 ½”/ 9” /10”
Chest:  16” / 18” /21”/ 22 ½”
Waist: 19”/ 20” /22 ½”/ 26”
Length: 24 ¾” /26 /28 ¼”/ 29”

name: Stunning CHARLES BUKOWSKI t-shirt Platinum Silver
description:
Born as Heinrich Karl Bukowski in Germany and brought to the United States where he was beaten as a child by his father, suffered disfiguring boils across his face as an adolescent and young man, started drinking by age 16 when his friend "Baldy" Mullinax, son of an alcoholic surgeon, gave him his first cold one (About which he later wrote: "This [alcohol] is going to help me for a very long time), took buses around the country during the Great Depression drinking during the day and fighting at the bars by night, lost his virginity to an older fat prostitute at age 24, and published his first story the same year and then went on a "ten-year drunk" only to start writing again to become the famous American poet you know and love and hate and admire.

Printed in BLACK on a PLATINUM SILVER100% cotton t-shirt, this picture shows Bukowski as gorgeous as he was mean, with his trusty and eternal beer.

Size: SMALL

name: BILL HICKS Funniest Man in the World T-Shirt
description:
William Melvin Hicks was just sixteen years old when he snuck out of his house to perform stand up comedy at the Comedy Workshop in Houston in 1978. During the 1980s he toured America extensively and performed a number of high profile television appearances. It was in the UK, however, where Hicks first amassed a significant fan base, packing large venues with his 1991 tour. Hicks died of pancreatic cancer in 1994 at the age of 32. He was and still is one of the funniest comedians of all time. We pay him homage here with his beloved cigarette.



A BEAUTIFUL SILVER PRINT ON A BLACK 100% COTTON T-SHIRT

name: DIVINE as Dawn Davenport in Female Trouble V-NECK
description:
Harris Glenn Milstead (October 19, 1945 – March 7, 1988) was an American singer and actor best known by his drag persona Divine. He starred in many of John Waters' films, including Mondo Trasho, Multiple Maniacs, Pink Flamingos, Female Trouble, Polyester, and Hairspray, as part of Waters' regular troupe of actors known as Dreamlanders. The New York Times said of Milstead's films in the 1980s, "Those who could get past the unremitting weirdness of Divine's performance discovered that the actor/actress had genuine talent, including a natural sense of comic timing and an uncanny gift for slapstick.

HERE SHE IS PICTURED AS A LITTLE LESS "COSMOPOLITAN" DAWN DAVENPORT FROM THE FILM "FEMALE TROUBLE."

A WHITE PRINT ON A BLACK 100% COTTON V-NECK T-SHIRT

name: Ian Curtis JOY DIVISION T-Shirt
description:
Ian Curtis (15 July 1956 – 18 May 1980) was the songwriter, lyricist and singer of the English post-punk band Joy Division. Joy Division released its critically-acclaimed debut album Unknown Pleasures in 1979, and recorded their follow-up Closer in 1980. Suffering from epilepsy and a failing marriage, Curtis committed suicide in May 1980, on the eve of Joy Division's first North American tour.

Now you can enjoy his face 24 hours a day with this t-shirt from one of his live shows.

A WHITE PRINT ON A BLACK 100% COTTON T-SHIRT


T-Shirt Size Chart

Sleeve 7” 8 ½” 9” 10”

name: Free T-Shirt. Buy This Book and get ANY shirt in the shop for FREE
description:
THIS IS FOR OUR FANATICAL READERS WHO LOVE WAR AND LOVE STORIES AND DREAMS AND NIGHTMARES AND FOR THOSE OF YOU WHO LIKE TO GET THINGS FOR FREE.

What another famous writer said about Love Songs & Monster Songs:

"[Love Songs & Monster Songs] is a pregnant book...a crazy bible for future generations. This book is a feast of life and war and death and dreams..."

Scott McClanahan, author of Stories, Stories II and Stories V


FOR THOSE OF YOU WHO LOVE OUR BURROUGHS, BUKOWSKI AND HUNTER S. THOMPSON SHIRTS THIS A FANTASTIC DEAL.

IN FACT, IT IS A $55.00 VALUE FOR ONLY $27.00! AND FOR ALL DOMESTIC ORDERS SHIPPING IS ALSO FREE!

OK, SO HERE’S THE STORY:

Though it is no secret that we like to read, this is a first for a Sleazy. Yes, it's a book. But it's a damn good one. In fact, we are so sure that you are going to fall in love with this dark and evil, beautiful and amazing book, that we are going to GIVE YOU ANY SHIRT IN THE SHOP FOR FREE WHEN YOU PURCHASE IT!!!!!!!!! FREE FREE FREE! SHOULD WE SAY IT AGAIN?

FREE.

HOW?

BUY THE BOOK AND IN THE NOTES FIELD AT PURCHASE SIMPLY TELL US WHAT SHIRT YOU WANT AND WHAT SIZE. WE WILL THEN SEND IT TO YOU AND YOU WILL HAVE IT IN ABOUT 3-5 BUSINESS DAYS (DOMESTIC ONLY).

WHY?

SURE, YOU CAN BUY THE BOOK ON AMAZON OR ANY OTHER BOOK STORE IN THE WORLD BUT THIS IS A $55.00 VALUE FOR ONLY $26.99! AND AGAIN, FOR ALL DOMESTIC ORDERS SHIPPING IS ALSO FREE!

ALSO BECAUSE THE BOOKS ARE SIGNED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

AND ALSO BECAUSE WE LOVE MR. HOLDER AND WE ESPECIALLY LOVE HIS BOOKS, WE ARE TRYING TO HELP HIM RAISE MONEY TO GO TO RUSSIA TO DO A BOOK ON HOMEMADE RUSSIAN STREET DRUGS. THIS IS ONE GOOD WAY TO DO THAT.

IF YOU CONSIDER YOURSELF WELL READ AND YOU HAVE NOT YET HEARD OF G.M. HOLDER YOU MIGHT HAVE TO RETHINK THAT IDEA! IF YOU LIKE JOYCE AND PYNCHON AND VOLLMANN, HOLDER IS WHAT'S NEXT!


HERE IS ALL THE INFO
___________________________________________________

LOVE SONGS & MONSTER SONGS
by G.M. Holder


WHAT THE BOOK IS ABOUT:

REVISITING THE YUGOSLAV WAR TWENTY YEARS LATER

Twenty years ago this April, the war that would eventually tear the former Yugoslavia apart came to Bosnia when a small detachment of Serb soldiers, hiding in the Holiday Inn in Sarajevo, opened fire on a large crowd of demonstrators surrounding the Parliament building. On that day the world was introduced to a modern city and a country that would very soon after be swept under the jackboot of the largest ground war fought on European soil since World War II. But with the advent of the war in Bosnia, there were more than just scenes of combat on the nightly news. From this small country in Eastern Europe there suddenly came harrowing images of Nazi-like death camps, the absolute devastation of thousand year old cities, one of the longest city sieges since Leningrad, and from 1991 to 1999 the loss of over a million lives would change, not only the course of Balkan history, but the history of the world forever. In 2002, at age 24, G.M. Holder traveled alone to former Yugoslavia where he lived for eight months, shocked at how little had been done to reconstruct the former republics. Thus, in his new novel, Love Songs & Monster Songs, he examines a side of warfare very rarely documented: postwar life. Here, regeneration through violence, the tyranny of memory, and the absolute chaos of peace are just a few of the themes set forth by Holder in this novel which follows a young American narrator through four countries into the heart of Bosnia. On the eve of his departure, however, he falls in love with Lejla, a young woman who, coincidentally, escaped from Sarajevo with her family as a little girl. And with the recurring appearance of an angelic young girl brutally wounded in the four year siege of Sarajevo (who may or may not be a ghost of the war) his reasons for going there are slowly unraveled as she helps him to resolve a complex obsession for a country that he may never be able to fully understand. Symbolically, allegorically, and figuratively interlinked, the lives destroyed by the Yugoslav war are exhumed in a novel, not only about the civilian position as it shifted both during and after the war, but what has been reified in its afterlife when its people are not yet ready to forget. Here is a glimpse of life after the death of a country as it heals from the largest European conflict since World War II, recounted not only by someone who has seen these things firsthand, but by a believer in the ultimate beauty of its resurrection.



AUTHOR BIO

G.M. Holder was born in the United States in 1977. In 2002, at age 24, he traveled alone to postwar former Yugoslavia where he lived for just under a year, spending much of his time in Sarajevo. After returning to the United States he worked for almost ten years writing Love Songs & Monster Songs, which chronicles many of his experiences there. In 2007 he traveled to Northern California where he began research for a trilogy he has been writing since then about the Zodiac killer. Later that year he also hitchhiked across the country collecting stories for a book which concerns Gutterpunk, train hopping, and hitchhiking cultures. Amongst other ongoing projects he is also at work on a large book of Seven Apocalypses and a novel about chronic pain and the disability system. Though he is still widely unrecognized outside of underground literary circles, Holder’s lyrical and encyclopedic writing style is already being compared to the likes of Thomas Pynchon, James Joyce and William T. Vollmann. Since 2000 he has lived in Portland, Oregon. He is also the author of “The Introduction to the World.”
